description: From Arabic حَجّ‎ (ḥajj, “pilgrimage”), from حَجَّ‎ (ḥajja, “to go, to repair”).

entries.meaning: (Islam) The pilgrimage to Mecca made by pious Muslims; one of the five pillars of Islam.
examples: The word Hajj is explained by Moslem divines to mean “Kasd,” or aspiration, and to express man’s sentiment that he is but a wayfarer on earth wending towards another and a nobler world.
